file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 32-49-07-05 - BRAKE SHUTTLE VALVE - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL BRAKE SHUTTLE VALVE - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the operational check of the brake shuttle valve. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY BRAKE SHUTTLE VALVE - OPERATION- ALL 32-49-07-700-801-A ♦ AL CHECK EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 32-49-07 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-49-07-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. BRAKE SHUTTLE VALVE - OPERATIONAL CHECK A. General (1) Do the check of the brake shuttle valve with the aircraft on the ground or on the jacks. With the aircraft in ground condition, put the chocks at the MLG wheels. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-801-A/200 - AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-802-A/200 - AMM TASK 10-10-01-500-801-A/200 AIRCRAFT NORMAL PARKING HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200 HTS AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200 LG SAFETY PIN - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-L-87177 Lektro-Tech Super Corr-B-12350 AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH and RH MLG 1 Helps the other technician Cockpit I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Lift the aircraft on jacks (AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-801-A/200) "or" keep the aircraft on ground and put the chocks at the landing gears wheels ( AMM TASK 10-10-01-500-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 32-49-07 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Make sure that the landing gear safety pins are installed on the LH and RH MLG ( AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200). (3) Pressurize the hydraulic system 1 and 2 ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200). (4) If the aircraft is on the jacks, remove the electrical connectors of the air/ground proximity switches related to the MLG and NLG "or" open de air/ground circuit breakers B and D. It is to keep the aircraft in "ground" condition. J. Operationally Check Brake Shuttle Valve (Figure 501) SUBTASK 710-002-A (1) Do the check of the brake shuttle valve below: (a) Operate the pilot or co-pilot brake pedals. Result: 1 The MLG wheels are locked. NOTE: If the aircraft is in ground condition, make sure that the brake actuating pistons of all brake assemblies are in operation. (b) Release the brake pedals. Result: 1 The MLG wheels are unlocked. NOTE: If the aircraft is in ground condition, make sure that the brake actuating pistons of all brake assemblies are not in operation. (c) Operate the emergency/parking brake handle. Result: 1 The MLG wheels are locked. NOTE: • If the aircraft is in ground condition, make sure that the brake actuating pistons of all brake assemblies are in operation. • To prevent hydraulic fluid transference from system 1 to system 2 or vice versa, first apply brakes with the pedals and then pull or release the emergency/parking brake handle. (d) Release the emergency/parking brake handle. Result: 1 The MLG wheels are unlocked. NOTE: • If the aircraft is in ground condition, make sure that the brake actuating pistons of all brake assemblies are not in operation. • To prevent hydraulic fluid transference from system 1 to system 2 or vice versa, first apply brakes with the pedals and then pull or release the emergency/parking brake handle. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Depressurize the hydraulic system 1 and 2 ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 32-49-07 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) If applicable, lower the aircraft and remove the jacks (AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-802-A/ 200). (3) If applicable, Install the electrical connectors of the airground proximity switches related to the MLG and NLG. NOTE: Before the installation of the connector, apply the Lektro-Tech Super Corr- B-12350 into the plug connector to prevent corrosion and to clean the contacts. (4) If applicable, remove the chocks ( AMM TASK 10-10-01-500-801-A/200). (5) If applicable, close the air/ground B and D circuit breakers. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 32-49-07 Page 4 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
